name: Witt Istanbul Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I believe that 5* ratings should be used sparingly for when something is truly exceptional. No hotel deserves a 5* rating more than The Witt.
reviews.title: The most deserved 5* review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are fantastic - from emailing before our arrival to help us make plans through to giving us tips for some fantastic restaurants and making arrangements and sorting out taxis. They were beyond friendly, and nothing was too much hassle for them. On the basis of the staff alone, it deserves a great rating.
reviews.title: Oasis in the city of Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: But the rooms were really something else. Very generously sized and really comfortable (and the bathroom was a good size too) with a sitting area as well. Design and detailing was very well thought out and quality materials were used throughout. The bed was very comfortable and nice linen as well. The view was also great.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious with quality local ingredients and the home made jams were delicious.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: Location wise, it worked really well, plenty of interesting places within walking distance and taxis for everything else. We went to most of the other 'cool areas' for hotels, and the area where The Witt is was by far out favourite!
reviews.title: so lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Traveling to Istanbul for the first time, we took a guess on what neighborhood we wanted to stay in ... and which hotel. And in celebration of my upcoming big 25x2 birthday, we decided to splurge a bit for this trip. And I'm so glad that we chose the Witt Suites hotel ..... and that we chose a balcony. Everything about this hotel was spot on perfect.
reviews.title: Without a Doubt - A Perfect Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The neighborhood was ideal. Fantastic narrow streets with shops, coffee spots, bars and interesting sights within walking distance to the hotel. Close walk to the tram / trolley - and within minutes to the big sights. One fun but a tad exhausting point - the walk from the tram is 5 minutes to the hotel - but straight up a steep hill (san francisco-like hill). Each time we returned to the hotel, we took a deep breath and up we climbed.
reviews.title: Wonderful chic hotel in the perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My recommendation - spend the extra money and get a balcony. The view from our balcony overlooking the galata tower with views of the old neighborhood and mosques were spectacular. We made a point of returning back to the hotel and sunset - to sit on our balcony with glass of wine and nibbles that we picked up - to watch the sunset and to listen to the call for prayer. So otherworldly and beautiful ....
reviews.title: Perfect experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Room was perfect .... never heard others on our floor, bed was comfortable, fantastic shower, free internet, beautifully designed lobby, the hotel staff couldn't not have been nicer - everyone was helpful and generous, and the free breakfast in the lobby was awesome. If the fresh figs are in season and available eat - then you must have some.
reviews.title: Modern, Chic, and a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, staying as a gay couple was not a problem at all. Not that I was concerned about safety, I do sometimes worry about awkwardness while visiting new places ..... and it wasn't an issue at all ..... everyone was friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights after three nights in the Old City. The hotel is absolutely perfect. Just 17 rooms and ours was the size of a small apartment. Perfect details in the room, there was a kitchenette, a sitting area with a TV, great firm bed and a huge bathroom. The staff is helpful and friendly and the breakfast is just right.
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely be coming back.
reviews.title: Witt Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just spent 5 nights at this fantastic place, one inadvertently after a late transfer caused us to miss a connecting flight. So, the up side of this situation was being able to go 'home' for one more evening...such helpful staff, they are a real credit to this hotel! Lovely, well appointed and clean rooms (with welcoming pastries), free wifi, excellent location (close to public transport which was our chosen method for getting around, it was so easy-although the walk up the hill is a killer!). Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.
reviews.title: Personality Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel . The hotel is well centered between Istanbuls different arreas close to the tram to take you to the old city , walking distance to Taksim sq . Great service from the staff , the rooms are large 45 sqm with design furniture a homey feeling with the mix of wooden floors and the marble kitchenet , the bathroom has inventive showerheads and the shape of the toilet is like a little spaceship. Breakfast is simple and nice .
reviews.title: Luxury Apartment Experience in Quiet, Upscale Beyoğlu Neighborhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Witt for 5 nights and had a terrific overall experience.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, beautiful rooms, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This georgeous hotel is well located close the main truistic attraction Taksim square just a walking distance ...when you walking around you can explore old neighborhoods ,coffee shops ,some vintage stores etc..if you'd like to walk longer you can reach the Nisantasi area which has stylish cafe`s and high fashion brands shops ,such as LV ,Beymen,Tods etc.. also designers boutiques .Beyoglu (this whole district called ) is always alive,for nightlife ,live music,good restaurants,bars ,shopping and many events to join ..
reviews.title: so cool !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Witt Istanbul Suit is a design boutique hotel with several awards so the interiors are so well chosen,its inspiring ,i love the elevator ,the suit that we stayed was having its own kitchen it was having everything you need for cooking , so cool decoration,quite good bathroom...
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Istanbul

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: so i definitely recommend this hotel !only think is the noisy neighborhood but if you want to live this city this is the way !!dont forget in this area there is no place quite ..no doubts about cleanliness everything was shining ...
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: A must stay in Istanbul - great location, stylish large suites, an elegant benchmark for all urban hotels. Friendly service, terrific breakfast, free wifi - the essentials for genuine hospitality. I would recommend this to anyone staying in the city.
reviews.title: Wow...you won't regret staying here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013
reviews.text: With so many great reviews of Witt Istanbul Suites, I don't want to repeat all the things that have already been said. All of them a true - the rooms are beautiful and spacious, the service is great and the staff are really good at giving advice about restaurants and bars in the area, the breakfast is above average. Actually, the only bad thing I can say about this hotel is the size of the bathrooms - ridiculously small, you'd think a hotel where all the rooms are "suites" would have decent sized bathrooms, but that is not the case. They're tiny. The rain shower is great though.
reviews.title: Perfect accommodation in a well located establishment with outstandingly good staff.

description: Witt Istanbul Suites has an excellent location within walking distance from Istanbul's business district, Istanbul Modern museum and the buzzing bars and boutiques of both Beyoglu and Cihangir. All 15 suites span a generous 60m2. They are popular for long-stay guests as each has a Carrera marble-clad kitchenette with microwave, fridge and Nespresso machine. The super-cool beds with curved headboards and the laptop desks have been especially designed for Witt Istanbul Suites by Autoban. Sheets and towels were also commissioned from Denizli, a famous purveyor of Turkish linen. Cable TV, an excellent DVD collection, ipod docks and a welcome gift of multi-coloured macaroons are indulgent touches. But it's the bathrooms that make these suites really special. The ergonomic Corian sinks with pebble-shaped handles and the cluster of shower-heads that create a cocoon of misty hot water are all from designer Ross Lovegrove's Istanbul collection from Vitra.
